Posts.Content: Hi Hun You need to get this tested by mamogrmme and ultrasound, to put your mind at easy  I was told by my GP that it's in the UK, that you have to be seen in two weeks of a lump being found.  So  to put yr mind at easy  Hope all goes well. Xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Hi Hun You need to get this tested by mamogrmme and ultrasound, to put your mind at easy  I was told by my GP that it's in the UK, that you have to be seen in two weeks of a lump being found.  So  to put yr mind at easy  Hope all goes well. Xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Thank you so much, it's but my mind at ease. I did speak to my supervisor that Friday, and keep my work colleagues  updated via text and Facebook. They said I can call in for a brew and have a chat, so we do this when I get all my results back next week.  So I can given them an update. I love this forum, it really helps
Posts.Title: Time off work and do I have to keep my employee updated

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn It is nice to know there are ladies who feel like me.  My direct work colleagues are wonderful, and I hoping all being well I will be going to see them a Friday to have a brew and a good chat and most important a . Thanks again,  glad u r on the journey to recovery .❤️
Posts.Title: Time off work and do I have to keep my employee updated

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn Thank u so much. It just amazing how your life can change so quickly, but all my friends and family say how positive and strong I'm being,  but it helps with being surrounded by such lovely people. Sending hugs

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn Thank u Will let u know how I get on next wee Hugs ‍❤️‍

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn Thanks I really appreciate it, it's just some times my mind just goes in to over drive and start thinking all these stupid things. I've just never been off work for a long time b4 Sending hugs

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn That is amazing,  they say you need to learn something new everyday. That's amazing  Thanks again
Posts.Title: Time off work and do I have to keep my employee updated

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  I've been off for 3 weeks already.  My GP has signed me of until Aug.  Do I have to keep contacting my employees,to keep them updated.  I'm worried they can get rid of me
Posts.Title: Time off work and do I have to keep my employee updated

Posts.Content: Thanks this really helps me. As I said I think I will call in next week to say hi. My boss did say to me b4 I finished work on the 25th May, that they are getting a temp in for 6 months, so i don't have to worry about anything.  Not that he doesn't want me back, he didn't want me to worry.  If I came in he said if I did then it would be fine. My colleagues b4 and since have been fine, but I've never been off for such a long time b4.
Posts.Title: Time off work and do I have to keep my employee updated

Posts.Content: You are being very strong, don't be so hard on yourself.  You had major surgery and have a lot to cope with.  I've been through my surgery and is no way as bad as you, but I still very depressed myself. You need to recover physically and emotionally, so please talk to friends and family and you will get through this. Try and enjoy the sun and relax
Posts.Title: Why am I being so stupid.

Posts.Content: Hi clare I need to go back to my local Macmillan centre tomorrow to see if I need to drained again, they may even put in a drain. Next then week to find out my results.   Sending hugs
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Clare  Yippee  Went to one of my Macmillan nurses today, been drained but only 30ml not the usual 110ml.  So no drain, they say in of the right track.  So just need to go the hospital next Wednesday to find out the exact treatment. So a better day. Hope r u
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: I'm waiting on my results to come back.  Mine is 22mm grade 2 not found in lymph nodes.  But for the lazy 3 weeks I've had to be drained, due to a build up in fluid
